project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is about plugging into the plugin point exposed by JIRA and

- specify the title
- hijack the project post creation and redirect to GH
- separate buttons for Scrum + Kanban
- Simplified workflow by default without option to select

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Is there differing implementation between btf and OD that we need to consider? Application permissions?
A: (/) I don't believe there should be any, these would relate to installation of GH when it's not present and will be dealt with in subsequent stories

Q: What board configuration do we allow from this dialog?
A: (/) This story only covers the minimum - the user will be able to specify project name, key and project lead (all of that provided by JIRA already), and we need to create a board for that project, assuming simplified workflow

Q: What happens to our old create project+board dialog?
A: (/) Nothing
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to create a GH board straight from the JIRA create project dialog so it's easier for me

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

The below exception is thrown when trying to drag and drop cards:

{noformat}
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'done' of undefined
Resource: http://jdog.atlassian.net/s/en_US-pdht6n-418945332/813/47/f642fc5b3eb59a1ea7d18c77bc8eb1bf/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid/batch.js
Line: 2914
{noformat}

h3. Notes

his has happened a couple of times now. I dragged some issues into my active sprint then clicked 'work'

I get this error but the page still loads properly and the error goes away when i refresh
fields.summary: Error on rapid board after adding issues into the sprint

fields.description: Adding an issue to an epic adds a history entry for the Epic Link value, also the issue change date changes, but the issue isn't reindexed. Using the "Recently Updated" Quick Filter then fails to find the issuedd
fields.summary: Regression - Adding an issue to an epic does not reindex the issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When we create a sprint we have to select the date and time for the sprint to start/end.  The time picker uses click-and-drag interface to choose the time and it doesn't let you just type in the time.  We find it really awkward.

Personally, I find the Google calendar way of handling this problem much better.  They use a generously-sized input box that accepts lots of different formats of time. e.g. I can type "10am" or "10:00" and it parses it and converts it to the current display format.
fields.summary: Date/time picker is awkward to use

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After recent upgrade to the latest Greenhopper version 6.1.3.1, the following Greenhopper error appears : 

Details
Exception: Script error.
Resource: https://jira.atlassian.com/s/en_UKsx8qk0/710/2/1.0.8-beta/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector.js
Line: 0


It seems the error only occurs in Firefox.

The error disappears from the screen after refreshing the page.
fields.summary: Javascript error on Greenhopper boards after upgrade

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Today, a Scrum Master planning a sprint doesn't have a way of committing to completing sub-tasks from stories that they don't intend to close.  They either have to work on the sub-tasks from stories not in the current sprint and have the hour burndown appear to be ahead of the guideline, or they have to pull the stories and all of their tasks into the sprint in which case the hour burndown appears to be behind the guideline.

This was functionality that the classic boards supported (perhaps inadvertently), but it allowed the team to commit to a set of stories to complete and the tasks they could complete on stories that they know at the outset won't be closed.

I will leave the design of a solution to this to the GH team since you've purposefully left sub-types off the planning board.  I will propose a straw man to get this started though:
* Add a special "drop zone" at the bottom of the sprint that a story could be dragged to and which would trigger a dialog that would allow the user to select which tasks to include in that sprint. 
* Ideally the story would then appear in that sprint but with a visual designation (dimmed?) to indicate that the entire story wasn't committed.  
* A story would still only be committed to a single sprint but could conceivably have tasks included in 'n' other sprints.
* Zero story points from the story should be allocated to the sprints where a story has tasks included but where the story itself has not been committed.
* The hour total for the planning view should be updated to include the tasks from the story that were selected for inclusion.
* A task can only be in a single sprint
* In work view, users should only see the tasks planned for that sprint and the story swimlane should have a similar visual indicator to what's seen on the planning board (dimmed?) to show that it won't be completed in the current sprint
* The hour burndown report for the sprints should include only the tasks that were selected for inclusion in the sprint
* The sprint report should show an additional class of stories which are denoted as having had work done, but which weren't part of the commit.
* Issue search by sprint should show the stories and tasks that were committed to a sprint.  A story that had 3/10 tasks allocated to sprint 1, should not itself appear in a search for issues included in sprint 1.  But the three tasks included in sprint 1 should appear in the search results.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I want to commit my team to starting work on stories in my next sprint that won't be completed until the following sprint without including the full story in the team's commitment

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently issues will drop into a future sprint if one exists or to the backlog otherwise. This is inconsistent and causes confusion.
Update so that when closing a sprint with incomplete items the behaviour is predictable and enables better planning/organisation.

If no future sprints exist (in the board where the sprint is closed) move incomplete items to the backlog (placed according to rank)

If future sprints exist (in the board where the sprint is closed) give the options to move all items to:
* Named future sprint (pick one)
* Backlog (placed according to rank)

Consideration needed for incomplete work items in scenarios where not visible on the current board.
fields.summary: Ability to select destination for incomplete issues when closing a sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In a scrum board, a quick filter that applies a subtraction condition to the filter that is set to the board does not work if this filter is using a field of type _label_.

No quickfilter selected
!Board1.png!

"NOT test label" quick filter selected
!Board2.png!

Board Filter: 
{code}
project = Bug OR labels = test ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

Quick Filter:
{code}
labels != test
{code}

When you click on that quickfilter all issues disappear from the board. You would expect everything but tickets with label=test to remain on the board.  

This behaviour seems to be inherited from JIRA JQL itself, as shown below:

When looking for issues where project = Bug you have 6 results (condition A)
!JQL1.png!

When looking for issues where labels = test you have 3 results (condition B)
!JQL2.png!

When looking for A OR B you have 9 results 
!JQL3.png!

When simulating a quickfilter to subtract issues "A" ((A OR B) - A), you'll have B as result - Everything good so far
!JQL4.png!

Now, when simulating a quickfilter to subtract issues "B" ((A OR B) - B), you'll have nothing where you'd expect 6 issues as a result
!JQL5.png!
fields.summary: Quick filter does not work as expected

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Create a new project
- Create one workflow for the regular issue types and another workflow for the sub-tasks issue type. Associate these workflows to a workflow scheme, and the workflow scheme to the newly created project
- Create one issue and several sub-tasks to it
- Create the following filter:

{noformat}
parent = TST-1 ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}

- Now, create a Kanban board
- Change the filter associated to the board to the one created before
- Now, try to drag the unmapped statuses from the workflow associated to the sub-tasks to the columns. Once you drag the first status, all the other disappear. The status that was just mapped will be displayed with a (!) next to it. when putting the cursor on it, the following message will be displayed: "This status is not available in any of the workflows used by this board. To remove, drag it to unmapped statuses where it will no longer be available."
fields.summary: Kanban board filter that only retrieves sub-tasks doesn't work when sub-tasks use a different workflow than the parent issue

fields.description:
h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Remove all groups from Browse Project Permission in Default Permissions Scheme
# Create a new project in JIRA in Administration > Projects (should be successful)
# Navigate to GreenHopper Getting started page
# Click on {{Create a new project and board}}

h5.Expected Result
# Expected project to be created but unable to view

h5.Actual Result
# Project cannot be created with error message: "You must have the Browse permission in the default permission scheme in order to create a project through Greenhopper"

The project should be able to be created, but should not be viewable without the group added to the Browse Project permission in the Default Permission Scheme.  JIRA allows this because when projects are created, they do not redirect to the project.

This is a minor issue, but the error message is a little confusing.
fields.summary: Error message unclear when creating a Project and Board on Getting Started Page without Browse Project Permission

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: After having done a full release plan with multiple sprints it is not possible to change the order of the sprints in Plan mode. This makes it difficult to create sprints ahead and then change the orders around based on priority changes in the backlog. Sometimes priority changes would result in not just moving individual stories between sprints but changing the sprints around completely. This is currently not possible. Also if you have created several sprints and needs to add sprints in the middle due to time consumption higher than expected you can not do that either.
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper User, I would like to re-arrange sprints in the Planning mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As Patrick, I want to be able to specify a startDate for my fixVersion when creating it so that my charts can be displayed in a reasonable way.

# allow to specify startDate when creating a version within GH
# store as date with UTC timezone
fields.summary: Store startDate for fixVersion

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{{As an admin I'd like to set the default value for the Estimation field on new Greenhopper boards}}

As an admin I'd like to be able to set 'Original Estimate' (for example) as the default value for the Estimation to be used on every board created.

Currently the Estimation always use 'Story points' and we need to change the Estimation manually for each board created.

It would save a lot of time if that could be set as a default value on Greenhopper configuration so newly created boards are already with the desired value.
fields.summary: Ability to set the default Estimation field on new Agile boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The prioritization of sub-task in Issue view page would not reflect the ranking of sub-task in GreenHopper as it uses the ranking instead. Thus, it would be great if ranking the sub-tasks within the parent issue/story is possible in the Plan mode. The work would be less efficient if the sub-tasks are able to be ranked in Work mode. 

Lets assume that there are 10 stories inside the sprint and each of the stories has 10 sub-tasks to be ranked. It isn't an efficient way to work where you would require to plan twice: once in during the Plan mode for the stories, and another during the work mode for the sub-tasks.
fields.summary: As a rapid board user, able to rank sub-task in Plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are using JIRA for project tracking, in an endless project that now contains a lot of issues. I know that (at least in my team) we are not using JIRA as intended, but still I would like to point out this problem:

When I open the Hour burndown chart, the y-axis is mis-set, and I can not see the actual lines as they are beyond the chart.

I hope you understand that I can not provide a dataset to reproduce this problem.
fields.summary: When number of hours is large, y-axis in hour burndown chartis not scaling correctly

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Uncaught Uknown exception when click "Where is my field?" link in Create Epic Screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When creating a sprint, the time is taken into account with the date. This leads to stories getting excluded from the burndown chart when they are closed before that time on the first day.

To reproduce:
- Create a sprint a 5:30 PM
- Set its start date to the next day (this should mean that the sprint starts the next day, on morning, and the day is fully considered)
- On the next day, before 5:30 PM, close a story

=> The burndown chart doesn't show anything as completed on the first day. The initial point count is decreased by the amount of points that were closed. The list below the burndown chart is updated for the closed stories to indicate "0", even though they have points.
fields.summary: Sprint Start Date takes time into account, leading to stories' points not being shown in burndown chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, there is no way to edit or control the notifications sent by GreenHopper. Sometimes, some users would not want to receive notifications over minor changes (for example, Epic Name, or Epic color).

It would be useful if the user could somehow control these notifications, for example, in the Notification Scheme.
fields.summary: Allow control over JIRA Agile notifications

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have a Scrum board which includes issues with subtasks. Both parent and subs have time estimates. JIRA's timetracking is set to include subtasks. The burndown chart ignores the subtasks' time values though and only displays the parent value.
fields.summary: Subtask time estimate rollup is ignored in burndown chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The rapid board adds some super nice planning features, and we love the ability to edit issues directly in the 'Work' component of the rapid board. But the tasks and stories are rather disorganized.

The task board presented a beautiful layout and hierarchy of parent to child. It was easy to visualize the entire sprint, each story was logically partitioned from another. Sure, the page is sometimes long, but people have multiple size views to choose from if that's a concern.

The rapid board (5.9.4) doesn't give nearly as crisp and clear a view of the sprint. Tasks are hardly distinguishable from stories, there really isn't much to distinguish between parent (story) and child (task). And most importantly, there's no clean way of partitioning between stories (i.e. like the Task board creates horizontal swim lanes per story).

The Task Board creates a *full picture* of the entire sprint. The Rapid Board is feeling a bit more jumbled together, less crisp, it doesn't paint a picture of the sprint as well.

A concrete example to express the point: when a task is "In Progress" it only shows the parent ID "TT-1" for example. But nobody knows stories by their ID. 

For example: if I have two tasks with similar names assigned to two different stories, as in the example below:

Story: As a user I want a new page X
   -> Task: Cut PSD into Images [12hrs]

Story: As a user I want a new page Y
   -> Task: Cut PSD into Images [12hrs]

We're in trouble! It will be devilishly hard to distinguish between these tasks in the Rapid Board, but in the task board, due to its good organization, this is a non-issue. 

This is a real example from our current sprint. And it occurs many times over with simple task names such as "test some feature". With the rapid board, as is, we'll have to be much more vigilant about including identifying information in the task descriptions.

A minimalist solution would at least be to include the parent "description" in the "In Progress" list rather than just ID. But I think I'm going to miss my horizontal swim lanes per story as we have in the Task Board. 

Your task board is good, don't abandon it in full.
fields.summary: Rapid board lacks clear separation of sprint stories as the Task Board has

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: For example, sort left column by priority and right column by update date
fields.summary: Allow sorting columns independently in the taskboard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Like the ability to change the Rank numbers for the Rank field. The system automatically assigns a number which is large example 2040. It would be nice when you start a new sprint you were given the ability to start a new Ranking order just for that Sprint. For example start with "1" or "10", etc. Is there a way to accomplish this?
fields.summary: Ability to change Ranking numbers for the Rank Feild

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Would like to display the Rank Field in the Card and List Views. When you drag & drop the cards it would be nice to see each card Ranking number. You can view this in the Issue Navigator, but needs to be shown in GreenHopper. Otherwise there is no visual clue.
fields.summary: Ability to add the Rank Filed in Card and List Views.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The rapid board sprint market is just the coolest thing since sliced bread, really!

So why not release markers? The easiest way to manage which issue is in a release and which not is to have a market that indicates where the release takes place. And we could easily count points in the release.

This is exactly how we organize the backlog in Excel (we've yet been convinced of moving the backlog to greenhopper, but are hoping to do so with the new Rapid board improvements).

Why would we use a planning board for releases and the rapid board planning for sprints? The rapid board is totally capable of taking over this functionality.
fields.summary: Rapid board planning - Where the release marker?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
GH Classic has a version synchronizer that ensures that fixversion hierarchies are properly up to date for issues edited in JIRA.

Rapid board won't support hierarchies, and as a result dnd an issue to a new version will remove the hierarchy, which then would be readded by the synchronizer.

Add some way of warning the user that the synchronizer is active (if it is), to ensure they disable it when starting to use versions on the rapid board

More general: think about how we want to deal with the Version Synchronizer once we introduce version on the RB
fields.summary: As a user I want to be warned when the version synchronizer is enabled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When I'm using the Plan Mode and I assign issues to Epics, I am able to see the "Epic" label in the JIRA ticket. However, if I actually open up the ticket and view it in JIRA, I cannot see the Epic label.
I would like to be able to assign an issue to an Epic using the JIRA edit screen.
fields.summary: As a user I would like the ability to set the Epic link through JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently it is only possible to expand/collapse sprints that are already started. It would be great to do that to upcoming sprints and backlog as well.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to expand/collapse any sprint or the backlog in the Plan View
